item.title: New York Court Bans Genius Group from Trading Stocks and Holding Bitcoin
item.description:
A New York court blocks Genius Group from raising funds or buying Bitcoin, forcing the AI-focused company to liquidate part of its Bitcoin treasury amid ongoing legal and financial challenges.

The post New York Court Bans Genius Group from Trading Stocks and Holding Bitcoin appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Illinois Drops Coinbase Staking Lawsuit, Following Other U.S. States
item.description:
Illinois plans to drop its lawsuit against Coinbase over staking services, joining other states in easing legal actions, though some cases remain open, reflecting shifting regulatory dynamics in the crypto industry.

The post Illinois Drops Coinbase Staking Lawsuit, Following Other U.S. States appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Senate Banking Committee Advances Paul Atkins to Lead SEC 13-11
item.description:
Paul Atkins, former SEC commissioner and Trump’s nominee for SEC Chair, secured committee approval in a 13–11 vote, sparking debate over his crypto ties, past regulatory record, and potential policy shifts.

item.title: BNY Mellon Launches Blockchain Accounting Tool, BlackRock as First Client
item.description:

item.title: Binance Co-founder CZ Donates 1,000 BNB to Thailand and Myanmar Earthquake Relief Efforts
item.description:
Binance co-founder CZ has donated 1,000 BNB tokens to support earthquake relief in Myanmar and Thailand. The funds, alongside a Binance Charity airdrop, aim to provide fast blockchain-based humanitarian aid.

item.title: CERT-UA Reports Cyberattacks Targeting Ukrainian State Systems with WRECKSTEEL Malware
item.description:
The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) has revealed that no less than three cyber attacks were recorded against state administration bodies and critical infrastructure facilities in the country with an aim to steal sensitive data.
The campaign, the agency said, involved the use of compromised email accounts to send phishing messages containing links pointing to legitimate

item.title: Critical Flaw in Apache Parquet Allows Remote Attackers to Execute Arbitrary Code
item.description:
A maximum severity security vulnerability has been disclosed in Apache Parquet's Java Library that, if successfully exploited, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on susceptible instances.
Apache Parquet is a free and open-source columnar data file format that's designed for efficient data processing and retrieval, providing support for complex data, high-performance
